neighbors.name: Charles Wesley Prince
neighbors.claims: Charles Wesley 'Chuck' Prince (b. 1937) was a lifelong Caldwell County machinist and farmer, admired for his strong work ethic and sense of community [Times Leader](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/times-leader/name/charles-prince-obituary?id=59675178). He passed away at age 88 in October 2025, ending his long tenure as a local landowner [Times Leader](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/times-leader/name/charles-prince-obituary?id=59675178).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach via Prince’s widow, Wanda, acknowledging their family’s deep local roots. Emphasize how the development will respect the land and honor the Prince family’s legacy in the community.

neighbors.name: Joe Oden
neighbors.claims: Joe Glendal Oden (1940–2025) was a Caldwell County native and U.S. Army veteran who returned home to farm tobacco and served two terms as a deputy sheriff ([www.tributearchive.com](https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/34543964/joe-glendal-oden#:~:text=in%20Caldwell%20County%2C%20Kentucky,was%20of%20the%20Pentecostal%20Faith)). He also owned a local auto body shop for many years, merging a strong work ethic with his passion for cars ([www.tributearchive.com](https://www.tributearchive.com/obituaries/34543964/joe-glendal-oden#:~:text=tobacco%2C%20volunteering%20on%20the%20rescue,was%20of%20the%20Pentecostal%20Faith)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Oden family through a mutual community contact (e.g. a fellow farmer or veteran) who knew Joe. Underscore the project’s commitment to caring for the land and ensuring public safety, reflecting the values he stood for.

neighbors.name: George Stopplecamp
neighbors.claims: No local records or news accounts place George Stopplecamp in any civic roles or public discussions ([www.lakelandchapel.com](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/Carol-Anne-Higgins-Stopplecamp?obId=3920412#:~:text=Stopplecamp%20www,Accessibility)). His late wife, Carol, was noted in a Princeton, KY obituary – indicating the family’s presence in Caldwell County – but no information on George’s views or activities has been found ([www.lakelandchapel.com](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/Carol-Anne-Higgins-Stopplecamp?obId=3920412#:~:text=Stopplecamp%20www,Accessibility)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Introduce yourself to Mr. Stopplecamp in a low-key, personal way (possibly via a neighborly referral). Because his priorities are not publicly known, focus on listening to any concerns he may raise and addressing them one-on-one.

overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the development, as none have been publicly quoted or recorded on the issue (their positions remain unknown). In terms of community influence, none are current officials; one neighbor (a former deputy sheriff and businessman) held moderate local influence through past service, while the others are known mainly as longstanding residents with low public profiles.
